name: Department-Specific Theories
description: Different departments maintain separate theory overlays with conflicting norms

theory.natural_language: The HR theory says remote work requires manager approval. The Engineering theory says remote work is default-allowed for engineers. In company-wide policy, HR overrides for contractors. Alice is an engineer. Bruno is a contractor in Engineering.

queries.natural_language: Under Engineering theory, is Alice allowed to work remotely by default?

expected_answer.natural_language: Yes. Engineering theory allows remote work by default for engineers like Alice.
expected_answer.explanation: ENG_theory SAYS remote_work ALLOWED_BY_DEFAULT true ∧ Alice IS_A engineer

queries.natural_language: Does HR's rule apply to Bruno as a contractor?

expected_answer.natural_language: Yes. HR overrides for contractors, so Bruno needs manager approval despite Engineering defaults.
expected_answer.explanation: company_policy HR_overrides_for contractors ∧ Bruno IS_A contractor

queries.natural_language: If the Engineering overlay is applied alone, would Bruno be allowed?

expected_answer.natural_language: Yes, in that isolated theory. The conflict appears only when company policy is applied.
expected_answer.explanation: ENG_theory alone allows remote_work by default
